docs.title: Goals and Context
docs.text:
Note: This section is used to give wider context to the development team and to ensure everyone is working to the same goal.

  • What is the goal?
  • What problem does this project solve?
  • What is the vision?

docs.title: User Personas
docs.text: Note: Three example profiles have been included. Depending on the complexity of your product you may need more. Typically we use at least 3 external users and all key internal users.

docs.title: Client
docs.text: User Type External User Name John Smith Gender Male Age 23 Education College Location City, Country Objective John is held up and wants someone to write him anarticle so that he can post to his blog

docs.title: Admin
docs.text: User Type Internal User Name John Smith 2 Gender Male Age 23 Education College Location City, Country Objective John is in a developer at the company.His role is ... He wants the website to ...

docs.title: User Stories
docs.text: Note: This section list high level and key user stories (often called Epics) that the website must support upon completion of the MVP (first) release. The typical format to use for stories is: As a type of user, I want some goal so that some reason.

docs.title: Client
docs.text: As a blog manager, I want great writers so that I can grow my blog.

docs.title: Admin
docs.text: As an admin, I want to be able to track jobs so that I can see what jobs are more freelancers.
